\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%

\item {} 
Select the slots from drop down

\end{enumerate}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
The window opens up as a seperate pop up

\end{itemize}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{GUI1_main}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Mouse over the desired block and click on it to view the slots

\end{itemize}

\subsubsection{\sphinxstyleemphasis{Steps}}

\item {} 
To open the window explicitly type the following code in cmd (Windows) or terminal (Linux)

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{prog2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{1}
\item {} 
Select the slots from drop down

\end{enumerate}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
The window opens up as a seperate pop up

\end{itemize}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{GUI2_main}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Click on the Choose Directory button

\end{itemize}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{GUI2_main_1}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Choose directory in which you have all your electives sheets

\end{itemize}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{GUI2_main_2}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
The application will automatically download all the concerned

\end{itemize}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{GUI2_main_3}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Select the basket you want to work upon

\end{itemize}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{GUI2_main_4}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
The window will get the informations about the basket including the baskets

\end{itemize}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{GUI2_main_5}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
A drop down will appear with the list of slots

\end{itemize}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{GUI2_main_6}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
The selected slot will be saved in the appropriate locations

\end{itemize}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{GUI2_main_7}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}

\section{\sphinxstylestrong{Developer Manual}}
\label{\detokenize{developer:developer-manual}}\label{\detokenize{developer::doc}}

\subsection{\sphinxstyleemphasis{Software Requirements}}
\label{\detokenize{developer:software-requirements}}
The following softwares are needed to be installed:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Python3

\end{itemize}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
tkinter

\item {} 
openepyxl

\end{itemize}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Sphinx

\end{itemize}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{sudo} \PYG{n}{apt}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{get} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{python3}
\PYG{n}{sudo} \PYG{n}{apt}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{get} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{python3}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{tk}
\PYG{n}{pip} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{openepyxl}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Sphinx installation in needed in case you want to work on the documentation

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{pip} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{sphinx}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Note that to compile the changes made to the documentation you have to move to the docs folder and compile your changes

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{cd} \PYG{n}{docs}\PYG{o}{/}
\PYG{n}{make} \PYG{n}{html}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The file will be changes in the \sphinxstyleemphasis{build/html} folder

For more information on working with sphinx you can refer:
\sphinxurl{https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/index.html}


\subsection{\sphinxstyleemphasis{Working on the Project}}
\label{\detokenize{developer:working-on-the-project}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
Clone the Repository

\item {} 
Working on any of the given modules:

\end{enumerate}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
GUI\#1

\item {} 
GUI\#2

\item {} 
Documentation

\end{itemize}


\subsubsection{Clone the Repository}
\label{\detokenize{developer:clone-the-repository}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{Got to the given link}] \leavevmode
\sphinxurl{https://github.com/PS-Ddevil/Time-table-assist-tool}

\end{description}

\item {} 
Click on the fork option to make a copy of the repo on your profile

\end{enumerate}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[width=0.800\linewidth]{{Fork1}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{2}
\item {} 
Go to a desired location on you local system(PC).

\item {} 
Open the terminal by pressing \sphinxstyleemphasis{Alt+Ctrl+T}

\item {} 
Run the command

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{clone} \PYG{n}{https}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{github}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{com}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{n}{git}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{username}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{Time}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{table}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{assist}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{tool}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{git}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Where \textless{}git-username\textgreater{} refers to the Username of your Github Profile


\subsubsection{Working on GUI\#1}
\label{\detokenize{developer:working-on-gui-1}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
Move to the cloned the folder
\begin{quote}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{cd} \PYG{n}{Time}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{table}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{assist}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{tool}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{quote}

\item {} 
Open the \sphinxstyleemphasis{prob1.py} file.
\begin{quote}

Open the \sphinxstyleemphasis{prob1.py} file in any text editor of your choice

For Sublime Editor:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{subl} \PYG{n}{prob1}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

For Atom Editor:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{atom} \PYG{n}{prob1}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

For Visual Studio Code:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{code} \PYG{n}{prob1}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{quote}

\item {} 
There are three broad sections in the code

\end{enumerate}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
GUI Development

\item {} 
Slot management algorithm section

\item {} 
Slot rendering section

\end{itemize}

SECTION 1:

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{dev_GUI1_1}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}

SECTION 2:

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{dev_GUI1_2}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}

SECTION 3:

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[scale=0.6]{{dev_GUI1_3}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{3}
\item {} 
Modify the code accordingly and commit changes when necessary.

\end{enumerate}
